required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determining the Benefits of Improving Communication in BPAP/CPAP Users
clinical_study.official_title: Determining the Benefits of Improving Communication in BPAP/CPAP Users

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness of a non-invasive communication aid for BPAP/CPAP masks. This study also looks to determine the potential impact of the device on patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) and the individuals that interact with the device.

detailed_description.textblock:
Noninvasive positive pressure ventilation (NIPPV) is a crucial tool used to treat respiratory distress and failure, especially when patients have acute worsening (also called exacerbations) of emphysema or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). This study will randomize patients who use Noninvasive positive pressure ventilation (NIPPV) to a control (non-functioning) and intervention (functioning) device to determine how well speech can be understood while wearing the device.
The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness of a non-invasive communication aid for BPAP/CPAP masks. This study also looks to determine the potential impact of the device on patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) and the individuals that interact with the device.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of Single Word Selection (Proportion of Right Words From Total)
primary_outcome.description: Data will be collected using audio recording - accuracy of single word selection (spoken by patient -> selected by partner). The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. A list of single words will be provided to the patient. Each single word may be read aloud by patient up to two times. The partner must then select the read word out of a list of twelve possible words.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of Sentence Selection (Proportion of Right Sentences From Total)
primary_outcome.description: Data will be collected using audio recording - accuracy of sentence selection (spoken by patient -> transcribed by partner). The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. A list of 5-word through 15-word sentences will be provided to the patient. Each sentence may be read aloud by patient up to two times. The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mask on with communicator on (20 min)
secondary_outcome.description: STI is a numeric representation measure of communication channel characteristics whose value varies from 0 = bad to 1 = excellent.On this scale, an STI of at least 0.5 is desirable for most applications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects That Found That the Device Significantly Improved Noninvasive Ventilation (NIV) Comfort
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects that found that the device significantly improved noninvasive ventilation (NIV) comfort was calculated and reported. Assessment of noninvasive ventilation (NIV) comfort was conducted using Likert Scale Score on clarity of communication on a symmetric seven-level agree-disagree scale.

arm_group.description: The F2S Communication System is a communication aid for use with a noninvasive ventilation (NIV) mask covering at least the mouth. It is a two-component system consisting of (1) a disposable, single patient use patch and signal cable and (2) a reusable communicator with power cable.The non-invasive aid for patients receiving BPAP/CPAP therapy delivers communication between the patient and medical personnel.
Non-functioning study communication device is used.

intervention.description: The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. The study coordinator will ENABLE the communicator. A list of single words and 5-word through 15-word sentences will be provided to the patient. Each single word may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must then select the read word out of a list of twelve possible words. Each sentence may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form. A survey will be provided to evaluate the "mask on, communicator on" period.

The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. The study coordinator will DISABLE the communicator. A list of single words and 5-word through 15-word sentences will be provided to the patient. Each single word may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must then select the read word out of a list of twelve possible words. Each sentence may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form. A survey will be provided to evaluate the "mask on, communicator on" period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must be receiving BPAP/CPAP therapy in the outpatient setting (e.g. clinics, sleep centers).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intubated or have a tracheostomy.
- Vulnerable populations (children, pregnant women, decisionally impaired adults, and prisoners).
- Speech disabilities, reading disabilities, dyslexia.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: F2S Communicator
group.description: The F2S Communication System is a communication aid for use with a noninvasive ventilation (NIV) mask covering at least the mouth. It is a two-component system consisting of (1) a disposable, single patient use patch and signal cable and (2) a reusable communicator with power cable.The non-invasive aid for patients receiving BPAP/CPAP therapy delivers communication between the patient and medical personnel. F2S Communicator: The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. The study coordinator will ENABLE the communicator. A list of single words and 5-word through 15-word sentences will be provided to the patient. Each single word may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must then select the read word out of a list of twelve possible words. Each sentence may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form. A survey will be provided to evaluate the "mask on, communicator on" period.

measure.description: Data will be collected using audio recording - accuracy of sentence selection (spoken by patient -> transcribed by partner). The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form.

outcome.title: Speech Transmission Index (STI)
outcome.description: STI is a numeric representation measure of communication channel characteristics whose value varies from 0 = bad to 1 = excellent.On this scale, an STI of at least 0.5 is desirable for most applications.
outcome.time_frame: Mask on with communicator on (20 min)
outcome.population: A validated conversion for word/sentence accuracy and STI was not predetermined and the intent was to record at both the mask and the speaker. However, the conversion was not able to be determined and recording at the mask level was limited by the device. Thus, there is no effective comparator to calculate STI and this information is unavailable.

group.title: F2S Communicator
group.description: The F2S Communication System is a communication aid for use with a noninvasive ventilation (NIV) mask covering at least the mouth. It is a two-component system consisting of (1) a disposable, single patient use patch and signal cable and (2) a reusable communicator with power cable.The non-invasive aid for patients receiving BPAP/CPAP therapy delivers communication between the patient and medical personnel. F2S Communicator: The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. The study coordinator will ENABLE the communicator. A list of single words and 5-word through 15-word sentences will be provided to the patient. Each single word may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must then select the read word out of a list of twelve possible words. Each sentence may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form. A survey will be provided to evaluate the "mask on, communicator on" period.

group.title: Non-functioning Communicator
group.description: Non-functioning study communication device is used. Non-functioning Communicator: The communicator will be attached to the BPAP/CPAP mask. The study coordinator will DISABLE the communicator. A list of single words and 5-word through 15-word sentences will be provided to the patient. Each single word may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must then select the read word out of a list of twelve possible words. Each sentence may be read aloud up to two times. The partner must transcribe each sentence on a standardized form. A survey will be provided to evaluate the "mask on, communicator on" period.

measure.title: Speech Transmission Index (STI)
measure.description: STI is a numeric representation measure of communication channel characteristics whose value varies from 0 = bad to 1 = excellent.On this scale, an STI of at least 0.5 is desirable for most applications.
measure.population: A validated conversion for word/sentence accuracy and STI was not predetermined and the intent was to record at both the mask and the speaker. However, the conversion was not able to be determined and recording at the mask level was limited by the device. Thus, there is no effective comparator to calculate STI and this information is unavailable.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects That Found That the Device Significantly Improved Noninvasive Ventilation (NIV) Comfort
outcome.description: Number of subjects that found that the device significantly improved noninvasive ventilation (NIV) comfort was calculated and reported. Assessment of noninvasive ventilation (NIV) comfort was conducted using Likert Scale Score on clarity of communication on a symmetric seven-level agree-disagree scale.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
